The class {{tt|std::lconv}} contains numeric and monetary formatting rules as defined by a C locale. Objects of this struct may be obtained with {{lc|std::localeconv}}. The members of {{tt|std::lconv}} are values of type {{c|char}} and of type {{c|char*}}. Each {{c|char*}} member except {{tt|decimal_point}} may be pointing at a null character (that is, at an empty C-string). The members of type {{c|char}} are all non-negative numbers, any of which may be {{lc|CHAR_MAX}} if the corresponding value is not available in the current C locale.

===Member objects===
====Non-monetary numeric formatting parameters====
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} decimal_point | the character used as the decimal point}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} thousands_sep | the character used to separate groups of digits before the decimal point}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} grouping | a string whose elements indicate the sizes of digit groups}}
{{dsc end}}
====Monetary numeric formatting parameters====
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} mon_decimal_point | the character used as the decimal point}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} mon_thousands_sep | the character used to separate groups of digits before the decimal point}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} mon_grouping | a string whose elements indicate the sizes of digit groups}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} positive_sign | a string used to indicate non-negative monetary quantity}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} negative_sign | a string used to indicate negative monetary quantity}}
{{dsc end}}
====Local monetary numeric formatting parameters====

{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char*}} currency_symbol | the symbol used for currency in the current C locale}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} frac_digits | the number of digits after the decimal point to display in a monetary quantity}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} p_cs_precedes | {{c|1}} if currency_symbol is placed before non-negative value, {{c|0}} if after}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} n_cs_precedes | {{c|1}} if currency_symbol is placed before negative value, {{c|0}} if after}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} p_sep_by_space | indicates the separation of {{tt|currency_symbol}}, {{tt|positive_sign}}, and the non-negative monetary value}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} n_sep_by_space | indicates the separation of {{tt|currency_symbol}}, {{tt|negative_sign}}, and the negative monetary value}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} p_sign_posn | indicates the position of {{tt|positive_sign}} in a non-negative monetary value}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} n_sign_posn | indicates the position of {{tt|negative_sign}} in a negative monetary value}}

{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} int_frac_digits | the number of digits after the decimal point to display in an international monetary quantity}}

{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} int_p_sep_by_space | indicates the separation of {{tt|int_curr_symbol}}, {{tt|positive_sign}}, and the non-negative international monetary value|notes={{mark c++11}}}}
{{dsc mem obj | nolink=true | {{dsc small|char}} int_n_sep_by_space | indicates the separation of {{tt|int_curr_symbol}}, {{tt|negative_sign}}, and the negative international monetary value|notes={{mark c++11}}}}

The characters of the C-strings pointed to by {{tt|grouping}} and {{tt|mon_grouping}} are interpreted according to their numeric values. When the terminating {{c|'\0'}} is encountered, the last value seen is assumed to repeat for the remainder of digits. If {{lc|CHAR_MAX}} is encountered, no further digits are grouped. the typical grouping of three digits at a time is {{c|"\003"}}.

The values of {{tt|p_sep_by_space}}, {{tt|n_sep_by_space}}, {{tt|int_p_sep_by_space}}, {{tt|int_n_sep_by_space}} are interpreted as follows:
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc|0|no space separates the currency symbol and the value}}
{{dsc|1|sign sticks to the currency symbol, value is separated by a space}}
{{dsc|2|sign sticks to the value. Currency symbol is separated by a space}}
{{dsc end}}

The values of {{tt|p_sign_posn}}, {{tt|n_sign_posn}}, {{tt|int_p_sign_posn}}, {{tt|int_n_sign_posn}} are interpreted as follows:
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc|0|parentheses around the value and the currency symbol are used to represent the sign}}
{{dsc|1|sign before the value and the currency symbol}}
{{dsc|2|sign after the value and the currency symbol}}
{{dsc|3|sign before the currency symbol}}
{{dsc|4|sign after the currency symbol}}
{{dsc end}}
